doc.ContractDescription: THE PRIMARY MECHANISM BELIEVED TO HAVE SHAPED BOTH THE KUIPER AND ASTEROID BELTS BETWEEN THE ASTEROIDS' AND KUIPER BELT OBJECTS' (KBOS') INITIAL FORMATION AND TODAY IS THE COLLISIONAL CASCADE. HOWEVER, MANY QUESTIONS ABOUT THE BELTS' EVOLUTION REMAIN UNANSWERED OR CONTROVERSIAL, INCLUDING: 1) DID OUR SOLAR SYSTEM EVER APPEAR AS DUSTY AS THE EXTRASOLAR DEBRIS DISKS WE OBSERVE? IF SO, HOW AND TO WHERE DID THE LARGE AMOUNTS OF DUST GENERATED IN THE CASCADES DISAPPEAR? 2) HOW EXACTLY DID THE ASTEROID AND KUIPER BELTS' EVOLUTION PROCEED AS THE GIANT PLANETS FORMED AND BEGAN TO STIR THEM GRAVITATIONALLY? WE PROPOSE TO STUDY THESE QUESTIONS BY EXTENDING THE THEORY OF COLLISIONAL CASCADES TO INCLUDE THE COLLIDING BODIES' VELOCITY EVOLUTION SELF-CONSISTENTLY WITH THEIR SIZE EVOLUTION, USING BOTH ANALYTIC AND NUMERICAL TECHNIQUES TO INCORPORATE VELOCITY EVOLUTION VIA VISCOUS STIRRING, COLLISIONAL DAMPING, DYNAMICAL FRICTION, AND RADIATION PRESSURE INTO THE CALCULATION OF COLLISION RATES AND DUST PRODUCTION RATES. WE WILL THEN APPLY THIS NEW UNDERSTANDING TO FOLLOW THE ASTEROID AND KUIPER BELTS' EARLY HISTORIES.
doc.MajorAgency: INVESTIGATING THE HISTORY OF DESTRUCTIVE COLLISION
doc.MajorFundingAgency: INVESTIGATING THE HISTORY OF DESTRUCTIVE COLLISION

doc.ContractDescription: A HIGH RESOLUTION GLOBAL ANALYSIS OF OCEAN SURFACE VECTOR WINDS WAS DEVELOPED BY THE OBJECTIVELY ANALYZED AIR SEA FLUXES OAFLUX PROJECT LED BY THE PI. THE ANALYSIS COVERS THE ENTIRE SATELLITE WIND OBSERVING PERIOD JULY 1987 TO THE PRESENT AND IS A SYNERGY OF 12 SATELLITE SENSORS, INCLUDING 2 SCATTEROMETERS QUIKSCAT AND ASCAT, AND 10 PASSIVE MICROWAVE RADIOMETERS AMSRE, 6 SSMI SENSORS, 2 SSMIS SENSORS, WINDSAT ONLY WIND SPEED RETRIEVALS WERE USED. HOWEVER, ONE INTRIGUING ISSUE HAS ARISEN DURING THE DEVELOPMENT, THAT IS, OAFLUX DIFFERS CONSIDERABLY FROM QUIKSCAT IN THE WIND STRESS CURL PATTERN ASSOCIATED WITH THE GULF STREAM FRONTS, ALTHOUGH OAFLUX INCLUDES QUIKSCAT IN THE SYNTHESIS. OUR QUEST FOR AN ANSWER HAS LED TO A SURPRISED FINDING. ELIMINATION OF RAIN CONTAMINATED WIND VECTOR CELLS WVCS IN QUIKSCAT APPEARS TO HAVE A BIAS EFFECT NOT ONLY ON QUIKSCAT WIND STRESS DERIVATIVE FIELDS AT OCEAN FRONTS, BUT ALSO ON THE DECADAL TENDENCY OF THE QUIKSCAT 10YEAR TIME SERIES. OSCAT IS AFFECTED IN A SIMILAR WAY AT OCEAN FRONTS. THE SOURCE OF THE RAIN BIAS IS THE SYNOPTIC WEATHER SYSTEMS IN THE MID LATITUDE STORM TRACK REGIONS AND THE TROPICAL RAIN BELTS OF THE ITCZ AND SPCZ. AS THE WVCS AFFECTED BY RAIN ARE ASSOCIATED WITH CYCLONIC WIND STRESS CURLS, THE FREQUENT OCCURRENCE OF RAIN AT THESE PREFERRED REGIONS CAUSES A PERSISTENT REMOVAL OF CYCLONIC CURLS. ELIMINATION OF RAIN FLAGGED WIND RETRIEVALS IS DEEMED AS A PREREQUISITE FOR SUCCESSFUL APPLICATIONS OF THE KUBAND SCATTEROMETER WINDS. THE QUESTIONS WE HAVE ARE WHETHER THE INCLUSION OF RAIN FLAGGED WVCS IN KUBAND SCATTEROMETERS WILL HAVE MORE BENEFITS THAN WE KNOW COULD RAIN CONTAMINATED WVCS IN KUBAND SCATTEROMETERS BE IMPROVED THROUGH CROSS VALIDATION WITH SENSORS OPERATING AT LOWER FREQUENCIES HOW CAN WE EVALUATE THE VARIOUS MULTI SENSOR VECTOR WIND PRODUCTS, WHICH USE DIFFERENT MEANS TO RECOVER THE RAIN CONTAMINATED WVCS MISSING DATA BUT THE DIFFERENCES IN THE MEANS AFFECT THE WIND ESTIMATES ON SYNOPTIC AND MESOSCALES AND ON LOW FREQUENCY DECADAL AND LONGER TIMESCALE VARIATIONS THESE QUESTIONS HAVE NO STRAIGHTFORWARD ANSWERS, AS THEY REQUIRE COLLABORATIVE EFFORTS AMONG SATELLITE DATA RECORD DEVELOPERS, RESEARCHERS WHO USE SATELLITE DERIVED WIND PRODUCTS, AND ALGORITHM DEVELOPERS WHO WORK ON RAIN ALGORITHM REFINEMENT. ON THE INDIVIDUAL LEVEL, WE PROPOSE THE FOLLOWING FIVE SPECIFIC RESEARCH FOCI AS OUR CONTRIBUTION TO IMPROVING THE KNOWLEDGE AND UNDERSTANDING OF THESE QUESTIONS. THREE RESEARCH FOCI ARE TO ADDRESS TECHNICAL CHALLENGES I GLOBAL CHARACTERIZATION OF THE EFFECT OF RAIN BIAS IN KUBAND SCATTEROMETERS, II ENHANCEMENT OF OAFLUX TIME SERIES BY INCLUDING OSCAT AND ASCATB AND IMPROVING THE ESTIMATION AND UNCERTAINTY ANALYSIS OF NEAR SURFACE WINDS ASSOCIATED WITH SYNOPTIC STORMS, AND III IDENTIFICATION OF THE STRENGTHS AND WEAKNESSES IN OAFLUX, SCATTEROMETERS, AND OTHER SATELLITE BASED PRODUCTS IN REGIONAL AND GLOBAL APPLICATIONS. MEANWHILE, TWO RESEARCH FOCI ARE PROPOSED TO ADDRESS THE TECHNICAL CHALLENGES THROUGH SCIENTIFIC APPLICATIONS IV INVESTIGATION OF THE POTENTIAL SHIFT OF THE MEAN ITCZ LATITUDE POSITION AND ITS RELATION TO THE STRENGTHENING OF THE TROPICAL TRADE WIND SYSTEM, AND V INVESTIGATION OF THE COLLOCATION OF THE ANTARCTIC CIRCUMPOLAR CURRENT ACC FRONTS AND THE ZERO LINE OF WIND STRESS CURL AT MAJOR TOPOGRAPHIC OBSTRUCTIONS IS IT TOPOGRAPHIC CONTROLLED COUPLING OR A MANIFESTATION OF SURFACE CURRENTS ON SATELLITE WIND RETRIEVALS CLIMATE RESEARCH DEMANDS MORE THAN EVER A CLIMATE RECORD OF OCEAN SURFACE VECTOR WINDS TO ADDRESS PRESSING LONG TERM CHANGES IN THE ATMOSPHERE OCEAN SYSTEM. THE EXPECTED SIGNIFICANCE OF THE PROPOSED RESEARCH IS IN THE POTENTIAL TO RECTIFY AND IMPROVE THE RAIN BIAS EFFECT ON THE MULTI SENSOR SYNTHESIS AND TO ADVANCE TOWARD A HIGH QUALITY OCEAN VECTOR WIND CLIMATE RECORD WITH ACCURACY AND FIDELITY THAT MEET THE NEEDS FOR CLIMATE DETECTION AND ATTRIBUTION.

doc.ContractDescription: THE LONG-TERM GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO OBSERVE AND IMPROVE UNDERSTANDING OF WIND FORCING AND SEA-SURFACE HEIGHT VARIABILITY AT HIGH FREQUENCIES (PERIODS OF 1-20 DAYS) IN THE TROPICAL OCEANS. THIS PERIOD BAND IS OF INTEREST BECAUSE THE SPACE-TIME SCALES OF OCEANIC EQUATORIAL WAVES AT THESE FREQUENCIES HAVE HISTORICALLY MADE ADEQUATE OBSERVATION OF THE VARIABILITY DIFFICULT: THESE WAVES HAVE ZONAL SCALES THAT ARE VERY LARGE (EXCEEDING 3000 KM) AND MERIDIONAL SCALES THAT ARE RELATIVELY SHORT (~100 KM), MAKING ADEQUATE IN SITU MEASUREMENTS TOO COSTLY, AND THE SHORT TEMPORAL SCALES POSE CHALLENGES FOR OBSERVATION WITH SATELLITE ALTIMETERS BECAUSE THE WAVE PERIODS ARE SHORT COMPARED TO ORBIT REPEAT PERIODS. AS A RESULT, THERE HAS BEEN RELATIVELY LITTLE PROGRESS SINCE THE EARLY 1980S IN OBSERVING AND UNDERSTANDING EQUATORIAL INERTIA-GRAVITY AND MIXED ROSSBY-GRAVITY WAVES AND THEIR RESPONSE TO WIND FORCING. HOWEVER, WITH CAREFUL CONSIDERATION OF THE SATELLITE SAMPLING, IT IS POSSIBLE TO EXPLOIT THE LONG ZONAL LENGTH SCALES OF THESE HIGHFREQUENCY EQUATORIAL WAVES IN AN ANALYSIS OF SATELLITE SCATTEROMETER AND ALTIMETER DATA, OPENING UP NEW OPPORTUNITIES TO LEARN ABOUT THE PROPERTIES AND DYNAMICS OF THESE WAVES. THIS WORK SEEKS TO EXTEND THE INVESTIGATORS PREVIOUS WORK DONE ESTIMATING AND INTERPRETING THE WAVENUMBER-FREQUENCY SPECTRAL PROPERTIES OF THE OCEANIC EQUATORIAL WAVES AND THE WIND FORCING THAT DRIVES THEM. ONE GOAL IS TO EXTEND ANALYSIS OF OCEANIC EQUATORIAL WAVES IN THE 4-20-DAY PERIOD BAND FROM THE SPECTRAL DOMAIN INTO THE TIME-SPACE DOMAIN TO ADDRESS QUESTIONS ON THE SPACE-TIME VARIABILITY OF THE WAVES AND THEIR FORCING. A SECOND GOAL IS TO EXTEND WORK DONE IN ANALYZING THE RESOLUTION CAPABILITY OF THE SATELLITE SCATTEROMETER SAMPLING, AND THE ERRORS RESULTING FROM POORLY RESOLVED BUT ENERGETIC VARIABILITY, TO QUANTITATIVELY EXAMINE THE RELATIVE MERITS OF DIFFERENT APPROACHES TO ESTIMATING THE LARGE-SCALE DIURNAL WIND SIGNAL FROM COMBINATIONS OF RECENTLY INITIATED SCATTEROMETER MISSIONS. WE WILL ALSO WORK TO QUANTIFY THE REDUCTION IN ALIASING AND SAMPLING ERRORS IN GRIDDED WIND PRODUCTS THAT RESULT FROM BETTER RESOLUTION OF THE DIURNAL WIND SIGNAL. THE PROPOSED WORK WOULD USE SATELLITE SCATTER METER AND ALTIMETER DATA IN A NOVEL WAY TO ALLOW NEW INSIGHT INTO THE PROPERTIES AND DYNAMICS OF WIND AND SEA-SURFACE HEIGHT VARIABILITY AT HIGH FREQUENCIES (PERIODS OF 1-20 DAYS), A PERIOD BAND THAT HAS NOT PREVIOUSLY BEEN WELL OBSERVED BY THESE SATELLITE INSTRUMENTS.
doc.MajorAgency: HIGH-FREQUENCY WIND AND SEA SURFACE HEIGHT VARIABI
doc.MajorFundingAgency: HIGH-FREQUENCY WIND AND SEA SURFACE HEIGHT VARIABI

doc.ProductorServiceCode: 5865: ELECTRONIC COUNTERMEASURES, COUNTER-COUNTERMEASURES AND QUICK REACTION CAPABILITY EQUIPMENT

doc.ContractDescription: THE LEAD PROPOSAL FOR THIS INVESTIGATION ORIGINATES FROM THE UNIVERSITY OF ARIZONA, STEWARD OBSERVATORY UNDER PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR DR. CHRISTOPHER K. WALKER. THE SMITHSONIAN ASTROPHYSICAL OBSERVATORY (SAO) IS PLEASED TO SUBMIT THIS SUBSIDIARY PROPOSAL FOR ENGINEERING AND SCIENTIFIC COLLABORATION ON THE REFLIGHT OF THE STRATOSPHERIC TERAHERTZ OBSERVATORY (STO-2). THE INSTITUTIONAL PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR FOR THE SAO EFFORT IS ANTONY A. STARK, AND SCIENTIFIC CO-INVESTIGATOR IS BRIAN STALDER. SAO WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR THE REFURBISHMENT AND TESTING OF THE STO AT JOHNS HOPKINS UNIVERSITY APPLIED PHYSICS LABORATORY (JHU/APL). THE WORK AT SAO INCLUDES CONSULTATION ON THE REFURBISHMENT OF THE GONDOLA, PROVISION AND MODIFICATION OF EXISTING DATA ACQUISITION AND REDUCTION SOFTWARE, AND SCIENTIFIC COLLABORATION ON THE STO GALACTIC PLANE SURVEY. THE STO PROPOSAL ALSO REQUESTS SUPPORT FOR PARTICIPATION IN THE SECOND LONG DURATION FLIGHT (LDF) FROM MCMURDO SOUND IN ANTARCTICA, AND FOR SUBSEQUENT DATA ANALYSIS, SCIENTIFIC INTERPRETATION, AND PUBLICATION OF RESULTS.
doc.MajorAgency: REFLIGHT OF THE STRATOSPHERIC TERAHERTZ OBSERVATOR
doc.MajorFundingAgency: REFLIGHT OF THE STRATOSPHERIC TERAHERTZ OBSERVATOR

doc.ContractDescription: IGF::OT::IGF FEE FOR SERVICE FOR PROJECT ENTITLED, "GENOMIC PROFILING OF A DIVERSE BREAST CANCER COHORT"

OBJECTIVE THE GOAL OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO PRODUCE A COMPREHENSIVE SERIES OF MODEL PREDICTIONS OF SATURN'S UPPER ATMOSPHERE FOR THE CASSINI PROXIMAL ORBITS IN ORDER TO AID IN REFINING PLANNED IN SITU MEASUREMENTS AND IN INTERPRETING THE IN SITU DATA OBTAINED. MOTIVATION THERE ARE FEW REMOTE DIAGNOSTICS OF SATURN'S IONOSPHERE, AND THEY ALL SUFFER FROM UNIQUE LIMITATIONS. TO DATE, THE VAST MAJORITY OF OBSERVATIONAL INFORMATION REGARDING SATURN'S IONOSPHERE HAS COME FROM SPACECRAFT RADIO OCCULTATIONS, WHICH YIELD VERTICAL ELECTRON DENSITY STRUCTURE, NE(H), THOUGH ONLY AT DAWN OR DUSK. AN ADDITIONAL METHOD OF TRACKING THE PEAK IONOSPHERIC ELECTRON DENSITY, NMAX, INVOLVES THE DETECTION OF BROADBAND RADIO EMISSION (DUBBED SATURN ELECTROSTATIC DISCHARGE, SED) ORIGINATING FROM POWERFUL LIGHTNING STORMS IN SATURN'S LOWER ATMOSPHERE. A NEARBY SPACECRAFT CAN USE SED EMISSION TO DERIVE THE DIURNAL VARIATION OF NMAX NEAR THE STORM LOCATION AS SATURN ROTATES. UNFORTUNATELY THIS TECHNIQUE IS RELIANT UPON STORM ACTIVITY AND LATITUDE, AND CONTAINS NO ALTITUDE INFORMATION. FINALLY, INFRARED MEASUREMENTS OF ROTATIONAL-VIBRATIONAL EMISSIONS FROM H3+ NEAR 4 MICRON YIELD CAN YIELD COLUMN INTEGRATED TEMPERATURE AND DENSITY INFORMATION FOR THIS MAJOR ION. ASIDE FROM ONE SO-FAR UNIQUE OBSERVATION IN 2011, HOWEVER, H3+ EMISSION HAS PROVEN TOO WEAK TO BE DETECTED OUTSIDE OF SATURN'S AURORAL REGIONS. THE 22 PLANNED PROXIMAL ORBITS DURING THE CASSINI GRAND FINALE OFFER AN EXCITING OPPORTUNITY TO EXPAND THE CURRENT SET OF OBSERVATIONS OF SATURN'S IONOSPHERE IN A NUMBER OF UNIQUE WAYS. FIRST, CASSINI WILL DIRECTLY SAMPLE ION ALTITUDE DISTRIBUTIONS FOR THE FIRST TIME EVER. SECOND, CASSINI'S CLOSEST APPROACH WILL BE AT LOW-LATITUDES NEAR DUSK. THIRD, THE REPEATED SAMPLING OF A SIMILAR REGION OF SATURN'S UPPER ATMOSPHERE OVER THE 22 ORBITS IS UNPRECEDENTED, AND WILL CONSEQUENTLY ALLOW A MORE SIGNIFICANT STATISTICAL APPROACH TO INTERPRETING THE ACQUIRED DATA. IT IS IMPORTANT THAT WE UPDATE AND PREPARE THE CORRESPONDING MODELS NOW IN ORDER TO BE PREPARED TO TAKE FULL ADVANTAGE OF THE FUTURE OBSERVATIONS. METHODOLOGY OVER THE PAST DECADE WE HAVE DEVELOPED A ROBUST SUITE OF 1-D, 2-D, AND 3-D MODULES COLLECTIVELY REFERRED TO AS THE SATURN THERMOSPHERE IONOSPHERE MODEL (STIM). STIM IS THE MOST COMPREHENSIVE MODEL OF SATURN'S UPPER ATMOSPHERE CURRENTLY AVAILABLE, AND THE ONLY GLOBAL CIRCULATION MODEL (GCM). STIM'S CORE IS A 3-D THERMOSPHERIC GCM, WHICH CALCULATES IN A PHYSICALLY SELFCONSISTENT MANNER THE RESPONSE OF SATURN'S THERMOSPHERE AND IONOSPHERE TO EXTERNAL ENERGY SOURCES, THE BUILDUP OF TEMPERATURES AND PRESSURES, AND THE RESULTING HORIZONTAL AND VERTICAL WINDS. IT INCLUDES MODULES FOR SHADOWING BY SATURN'S RINGS, COUPLING TO SATURN'S INNER PLASMASPHERE, AND FOR ELECTRON TRANSPORT EFFECTS THAT ALLOW FOR SELF-CONSISTENT TREATMENT OF SECONDARY IONIZATION, THERMAL ELECTRON HEATING, AND AURORAL PRECIPITATION. USING THE UPDATED SPICE KERNELS THAT DESCRIBE CASSINI'S PROXIMAL ORBIT PARAMETERS, WE WILL PRODUCE A SERIES OF MODEL SIMULATIONS IN ORDER TO PREDICT WHAT CASSINI WILL MEASURE IN SITU. THESE INITIAL SIMULATIONS WILL COVER A WIDE RANGE OF INPUT PARAMETERS, SUCH AS SOLAR FLUX AND AURORAL PRECIPITATION, IN ORDER TO ACCOMMODATE ALL POSSIBLE VALUES PRIOR TO THE PROXIMAL ORBITS. DURING THE PROXIMAL ORBITS WE WILL INCORPORATE CASSINI IN SITU DATA IN ORDER TO FURTHER CONSTRAIN THE MODEL, AND WE WILL PRODUCE NEW SIMULATIONS WITH THE UPDATED FORCING CONDITIONS. WE WILL CONTINUE TO ITERATE THROUGHOUT THE REST OF THE CASSINI MISSION, IMPROVING BOTH MODEL PREDICTIONS AND OBSERVATIONAL CONSTRAINTS. FINALLY, WE WILL UTILIZE THE NEWLY IMPROVED STIM ALONG WITH THE NEW CASSINI MEASUREMENTS IN ORDER TO ADDRESS A NUMBER OF UNRESOLVED ISSUES IN SATURN'S UPPER ATMOSPHERE.
doc.MajorAgency: SATURN'S IONOSPHERE DURING THE CASSINI GRAND FINAL
doc.MajorFundingAgency: SATURN'S IONOSPHERE DURING THE CASSINI GRAND FINAL

doc.ContractDescription: THE RESEARCH OBJECTIVE OF THE PROPOSED EFFORT IS TO COUPLE FINITE ELEMENT AND MUSCULOSKELETAL MODELING TO ENABLE SIMULATION BASED DESIGN OF HUMAN EXOSUIT SYSTEMS, AND TO USE THIS FRAMEWORK TO EVALUATE OPERATIONAL PERFORMANCE SENSITIVITY TO PARAMETER CHANGES. THIS WORK BRIDGES THE DOMAINS OF BIOMECHANICS, HUMAN FACTORS, AND COMPUTATIONAL SOLID MECHANICS TO CREATE A MODEL BASED ENGINEERING APPROACH TO ANSWERING RELEVANT RESEARCH QUESTIONS. MANY CHALLENGES EXIST IN SIMULATING THE DYNAMICS OF TIGHTLY COUPLED SYSTEMS, SUCH AS EXOSKELETONS OR EXOSUITS AND HUMAN OPERATORS. THERE ARE CURRENTLY NO HIGH FIDELITY MODELS THAT ATTAIN ACCURATE REPRESENTATIONS OF BOTH A HUMAN OPERATOR AND WEARABLE DEVICE. ENABLING SYNERGISTICALLY INTEGRATED WEARABLE SYSTEM DESIGNS THAT AUGMENT PERFORMANCE, REQUIRES A TOOL TO EVALUATE DYNAMIC MOBILITY AND AGILITY OF THE HUMAN SUIT SYSTEM, IN PARTICULAR THE UNDERLYING HUMAN MOVEMENTS THAT GENERATE THE SUIT MOTIONS, THE SURFACE INTERACTION FORCES AND DEFLECTIONS, AND THE CORRESPONDING JOINT TORQUES. THIS EFFORT WILL FOCUS ON THREE AIMS THAT ARE DEMONSTRATED WITH THE APPLICATION OF EXTENDING EXPLORATION EXOSUIT MOBILITY 1 DEVELOPMENT OF A COUPLED FINITE ELEMENT AND MUSCULOSKELETAL MODELING OF THE INTEGRATED HUMAN SUIT SYSTEM 2 VALIDATION OF THE INTEGRATED HUMAN SUIT MODEL WITH COMPONENT LEVEL AND HUMAN SYSTEM EXPERIMENTAL DATA AND 3 EVALUATION OF OPERATIONAL PERFORMANCE SENSITIVITY TO CHANGES IN MATERIAL STIFFNESS, MUSCLE ACTIVATION ASSUMPTIONS, AND STRATEGICALLY PLACED ACTUATION. THE PROPOSED EFFORT WILL ADDRESS THE PROJECT AIMS BY IMPLEMENTING A MULTI TIERED MODEL FRAMEWORK TO CALCULATE INTERACTION FORCES BETWEEN THE HUMAN AND SUIT WITH CORRESPONDING SURFACE DEFLECTIONS AND PERTINENT JOINT TORQUES, PERFORMING A HUMAN STUDY TO VALIDATE THE MODEL ASSUMPTIONS, AND ANALYZING SENSITIVITY TO A SUBSET OF MODEL PARAMETERS.
doc.MajorAgency: NRI: EXOSUIT SYSTEM DESIGN PARAMETERS AS REVEALED
doc.MajorFundingAgency: NRI: EXOSUIT SYSTEM DESIGN PARAMETERS AS REVEALED

doc.ContractDescription: IGF::OT::IGF THE CONTRACTOR SHALL PERFORM AN AUDIT OF THE CERTIFIED FINAL INDIRECT COST RATE PROPOSAL AND RELATED BOOKS AND RECORDS FOR REIMBURSEMENT OF CONTRACTOR INCURRED COSTS AS SUBMITTED BY FISCAL YEAR. THE COMPANY AND FISCAL YEARS VARY AND ARE IDENTIFIED BY CLIN. THE PURPOSE OF THE AUDIT IS TO DETERMINE ALLOWABILITY OF DIRECT AND INDIRECT COSTS AND RECOMMEND CONTRACTING OFFICER DETERMINED INDIRECT COST RATES FOR FISCAL YEARS IDENTIFIED BY CLIN. THE AUDIT WILL BE CONDUCTED IN ACCORDANCE WITH GENERALLY ACCEPTED GOVERNMENT AUDITING STANDARDS (GAGAS).

doc.ContractDescription: PURCHASE ORDER FOR 15 EACH CONFORMAL BATTERIES AND 5 EACH CABLES

APPLICABILITY TO NASA EARTH SCIENCE (RELEVANCY SCENARIO) THE CONCEPT OF DISTRIBUTED MISSIONS WAS FIRST INVESTIGATED BETWEEN ABOUT 1998 AND 2002 THROUGH SEVERAL STUDIES FOCUSING MAINLY ON EARTH SCIENCE. SINCE THEN, THIS CONCEPT HAS NOT BEEN SYSTEMATICALLY INTEGRATED IN THE MAIN STREAM MISSIONS, E.G., DECADAL SURVEY MISSIONS, ALTHOUGH IT HAS BEEN CONSIDERED AND EVEN UTILIZED WHEN IT WAS THE ONLY SOLUTION CAPABLE TO SATISFY SOME GIVEN SCIENCE GOALS. NEVERTHELESS, THE CONCEPT CAN BE FOUND AGAIN IN MORE RECENT STUDIES; E.G., THE HELIOPHYSICS SYSTEM OBSERVATORY (HSO) MENTIONED IN THE 2010 NASA SCIENCE PLAN AND CONSTELLATIONS OF COMPLEMENTARY SATELLITES IN THE EARTH SCIENCE TECHNOLOGY OFFICE (ESTO) 2030 SCIENCE VISION. THIS GAP OF MORE THAN 10 YEARS IN THE INTEREST GIVEN TO DSM IS PROBABLY EXPLAINED BY THE COST AND POTENTIALLY THE COMPLEXITY ASSOCIATED WITH SUCH MISSIONS. THE HIGH COSTS THAT WERE ESTIMATED FOR POTENTIAL DSM WERE OFTEN THE CONSEQUENCE OF CONSTELLATION DESIGNS BASED ON REPEATING N TIMES THE DESIGN AND THE BUILDING OF ONE SPACECRAFT, THEREFORE LEADING TO COSTS BEING N TIMES THE COST OF A MONOLITHIC MISSION; THIS IS EXPLAINED NOT ONLY BY THE MISSION DESIGN ITSELF BUT ALSO BY COST MODELS THAT HAVE BEEN DESIGNED FOR MONOLITHIC MISSIONS AND DO NOT TAKE INTO ACCOUNT COST SAVINGS ASSOCIATED WITH ECONOMIES OF SCALE AND WITH RISK MINIMIZATION WHEN DEALING WITH DSM. ON THE OTHER HAND, IT IS TRUE THAT BUILDING A DISTRIBUTED MISSION ADDS TO THE COMPLEXITY OF THE MISSION, NOT ONLY IN THE DEVELOPMENT PHASE BUT ALSO IN THE OPERATIONAL PHASE, AND THIS COMPLEXITY TRANSLATES INTO ADDITIONAL COSTS AND RISK TO THE MISSION. THEREFORE, IT IS ONLY NOW THAT NEW TECHNOLOGIES AND CAPABILITIES SUCH AS SMALLSATS, CUBESATS, HOSTED PAYLOADS, ONBOARD COMPUTING, BETTER SPACE COMMUNICATIONS, AND GROUND SYSTEMS AUTOMATION HAVE APPEARED AND HAVE BECOME MATURE, THAT DSM SEEM TO BE FEASIBLE FOR A REASONABLE AND POTENTIALLY LOWER COST AND RISK THAN MONOLITHIC MISSIONS.
